Geography: originally from Mexico, now it is cultivated world wide
Medical Function: anti-oxidation effect
anti-inflammatory effects
protects animals against cerebral ischemia/reperfusion brain injury
exerts hepatoprotection via promoting antioxidative and anti-inflammatory properties against CCl(4)-induced oxidative liver damage
anti hypertensive effect
consumption of this herb may increase in vivo antioxidant activities and have some protective effects in decreasing oxidative stress in hypercholesterolemic subjects
Dosage: Fresh feng che cao (Graptopetalum paraguayense) used as a vegetable: 100 grams daily.
Research:
protects animals against cerebral ischemia/reperfusion brain injury.[1]
exerts hepatoprotection via promoting antioxidative and anti-inflammatory properties against CCl(4)-induced oxidative liver damage.[2]
anti hypertensive effect [3]
consumption of this herb may increase in vivo antioxidant activities and have some protective effects in decreasing oxidative stress in hypercholesterolemic subjects.[4]
References: [3] Journal of the Science of Food and Agriculture, 89: 2678�2686. doi: 10.1002/jsfa.3774
[4] J Sci Food Agric. 2011 May;91(7):1230-5. doi: 10.1002/jsfa.4304. Epub 2011 Mar 8.

E. Br.) Name: bai xian pi
Other name: Korean bai xian 朝鮮白鮮

Geography: Mainly in Liaoning, Hebei, Jiangsu, Shanxi, Inner Mongolia, Jilin; also in Heilongjiang, China
Medical Function: Clears heat and dries dampness
Dispels wind and relieves toxicity
Antifungal effect
Stimulatory effect on the heart and increases cardiac output of frogs
Marked vasospastic (constriction of blood vessels) effect on rabbit aural blood vessels
Effect on smooth muscle: stimulates the smooth muscles of the uterus of rabbits and guinea pigs
Dosage: 4.5 g to 20 g. Concentrated extract 0.5 to 2 g. For external use: appropriate amount. Boil with water and wash the affected area or make into powder and apply on affected area.
Samples of Formulae: For eczema, itchy rash: di fu zi (Kochia seed) 15 g, bai xian pi (Dictamnus dasycarpus bark) 9 g, chuan bi bo (Bupleurum chinense rhizome) 12 g, ku shen (Sophora flavescens root), ye ju hua (wild chrysanthemum) 98 g each, sheng di huang (raw Rehmannia root) 12 g, chi shao yao (red peony), dang gui (Angelica sinensis) 9 g each. Make into decoction with water. Drink as tea.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of cold from deficiency.

Boil with water and wash the affect area or make into powder and apply on affected area.4.5～10克 ；濃縮中藥：0.5～2 克。外用適 量 ，煎湯 洗或研粉敷。Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕For eczema, itchy rash:

ye ju hua 98 g each, 
  sheng di huang 12 g, 
  chi shao yao, 
dang gui  9 g each. Make into decoction with water. Drink as tea. 治濕疹，癢疹：

Name: mi hou tao
kiwi
Other name: qi yi guo (commercial name; sound translation of kiwi)

Maladies Treated: Heat and thirsty feeling (early stage of diabetes)
Root: lactagogue (promoting the flow of breast milk)
Leaves: being used in mammary gland inflammation (leaves washed, added alcohol and red sugar, pounded and applied externally)
Medical Function: Lowers cholesterol and triglycerides
Inhibits the production of nitrites, a cancer-causing substance
Root: diuretic effect
Root: pain inhibiting effect
Root: has the functions of clearing heat and detoxification, activating blood and resolving swelling, dispelling wind and benefiting dampness
Fruit: relieves heat and thirst, promotes urination
Samples of Formulae: Leaves: Washed, add alcohol and red sugar, pound and apply externally to treat mammary gland inflammation.
Contraindications:
Use care in cases of spleen deficiency.
Not suitable for those with diarrhea or loose stool.
Contraindicated in cases of signs of miscarriage during pregnancy.
Contraindicated in heavy bleeding during menses.
Contraindicated in frequent urination.
Research:
Today, most commercial growers in the world use a new growth stimulator, forchlorfenuron on grapes and kiwi fruits.
See this. http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=Retrieve&db=PubMed&list_uids=2402139&dopt=Abstract
Notes:
The name kiwi was created in New Zealand for commercial purposes.
Most commercial production worldwide uses 'kiwi' as the market name.
References: [1] The name kiwi was created in New Zealand for commercial purposes.

Now New Zealand is also a big producer.原産中國，現紐西蘭有大量商業性生産。Properties characteristics)﹕性味﹕Fruit: sweet, sour, coldRoot: bitter, tart, cold.果 ﹕ 甘, 酸, 寒獼 猴 桃 根  (藤 梨根) : 味苦涩 ，性寒Channels  meridians) entered: 歸經﹕stomach, kidney入胃,  腎經Medical functions:藥理﹕ Lowers cholesterol and triglycerides. Inhibits the production of nitrites, a cancer causing substance.降低胆固醇及甘油三酯， 抑制致癌物質亞硝酸鹽 的產生Actions & Indications:主治﹕Prevents or assists in treating hypertension, high lipids, hepatitis,coronary diseases, stones in the urinary tract.Being used in heat and thirsty feeling (early stage of diabetes); jaundice and lack of appetite; stomach cancer, cancer of themammary glands; HIV infection.The root possesses diuretic effect, pain inhibiting effect. It is beingused in impact injuries, swelling, edema, acute hepatitis, rheumatoidarthritis, as lactagogues (promoting the flow of breast milk).Leaves: washed and with added alcohol, smashed is being used inmammary gland inflammation.解熱止渴，通淋。對高血壓, 高血脂, 肝炎, 冠心病, 尿道結石有預防和 輔助治療作用。 用 來 治療煩熱消渴，納呆黃疸，胃癌, 乳腺癌，艾滋病毒感染。  獼猴桃根 (藤梨根) ，味苦澀，性寒，具有清熱解毒, 活血消腫, 祛風利濕的作用。 適於跌打損傷, 癤腫, 水腫, 急性肝炎, 風濕性關節炎, 肺結核, 乳汁不下等。 獼猴桃葉洗淨，加酒精, 紅糖搗爛熱外敷，可治乳腺炎。  Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕ 鲜果含：Fresh Fruit contain:3-甲基-2-丁酮3-methyl-2-butanone3-羟基-2-丁酮3-hydroxy-2-butanone(E)-2-己烯醛(E)-2-hexenal3-羟基丁酸乙酯ethyl 3-hydroxybutyrate苯乙醇phenyl ethyl alcoholα-松油醇α-terpineol香葉醇geraniol.Dosage:用量﹕root dosage: 15 to 39 g.猕猴桃根 15 ~ 39 g.Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕ Modern Research:現代研究﹕See this.http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=Retrieve&db=PubMed&list_uids=2402139&dopt=AbstractToxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Use care in cases of spleen deficientNot suitable for those with:diarrhea or loose stool. in cases of sign of miscarriageduring pregnancy.heavy bleeding during mensesfrequent urination 脾虛者應慎食；大便溏瀉者不宜食用。先兆性流產, 月經過多和尿頻者忌食。[1] The name kiwi was created in New Zealand for commercial purposes.註：奇異果（kiwi) 之名是紐西蘭人為了方便推銷而創的。 Today, most commercial growers in the world use a new growth stimulate, forchlorfenuron on grapes and kiwi fruits.Search this siteProblems with website? Name: fang ji
han fang ji
guang fang ji
Pharmaceutical: Radix Stephaniae tetrandrae (han fang ji 漢防己, 石蟾蜍, 粉防己)
Radix aristolochiae fangchi (guang fang ji 廣防己)
Radix cocculus trilobus (mu fang ji 木防己)
Biological: Stephania tetrandra S. Moore (han fang ji, fen fang ji 粉防己)
Aristolochia fangchi, Wu; (guang fang ji 廣防己, guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己)
Aristolochia westlandi, Hemsl. (guang fang ji 廣防己, guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己)
Cocculus trilobus DC. (mu fang ji 木防己)
Sinomenium acutum var. cinerascens Rhed. et Wils. (mao fang ji 毛防己)
Dioloclisia chinensis Merriel (hua fang ji 華防已)
Menispermum dauricum De Candolle (bian fu ge 蝙蝠葛)
Aristolochia mouppinensis Franchet (mo ping ma dou ling 穆坪馬兜鈴)
Aristolochia kaempferi Willdenow (da ye ma dou ling 大葉馬兜鈴)
Other name: guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己
mo ping ma dou ling 穆坪馬兜鈴
da ye ma dou ling 大葉馬兜鈴
Pronunciation in Korean: kwang bang gi (guang fang ji 廣防己)

Geography: Han fang ji (fen fang ji) is distributed in Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Hubei provinces.
Guangdong mu fang ji (guang fang ji) is distributed in Guang Dong and Guang Xi provinces.
Maladies Treated: In Japan, han fang ji is used as pain reliever for inflammation of nerves, stiffness of the shoulders, gout, and back pain.
In China, han fang ji is used for Bell's palsy, asthma, edema (as a diuretic).
Mu fang ji is used as a diuretic for edema and for gonorrhea.
Die Da Wan (跌打丸) some formulae contain mu tong or fang ji.
Medical Function: Lab animals receiving sinomenin injections showed increased reflex functions, spasms, paralysis, and death.
Chinese han fang ji showed that it can regulate body temperature.
Mu fang ji showed the properties of diuretics and relief of nerve inflammation pain.

Fen fang ji alkaloid is a calcium channel blocker, has bidirectional regulatory effect on the calcium-activated potassium channel, in addition to known activities such as antihypertensive, antiarrhythmic, and coronary vasodilation, also has new pharmacological effects such as anti-myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury, anti-pulmonary hypertension, inhibition of vascular smooth muscle proliferation, inhibition of myocardial cell hypertrophy, and modulation of cardiovascular active substances release.
Samples of Formulae:
The formulae listed below may contain the toxic type of mu tong or fang ji. Consult your local regulations before using them.
Ba Zheng San 八正散 (contains mu tong)
Chun Yang Zheng Ji Wan 純陽正氣丸 (contains qing mu xiang)
Da Huang Qing Wei Wan 大黃清胃丸 (contains guan mu tong)
Dang gui si ni tang 當歸四逆湯 (contains mu tong and xi xin)
Mu Xiang Dao Chi Wan 木香導滯丸 (contains mu xiang and may be confused with qing mu xiang)
Die Da Wan 跌打丸 (some Die Da Wan formulae contain mu tong or fang ji)
Guan Xin Siu He Ge Wan 冠心秀克閤丸 (contains qing mu xiang)
Ji Sheng Ju He Wan 濟生橘核丸 (contains mu tong and hou po)
Kat Kit Wan 解結前列丸 (contains mu tong)
Quell Fire Shi Xiang Fan Shen Wan 十香翻身(返神)丸
Xin Yi Wan 心怡丸
Dang gui si ni tang [Main indications and efficacy] For anemia, lower back pain, cramps, aching pain in the limbs, cold extremities, etc. Used for frostbite, intestinal hernia pain, lower back pain, beriberi, uterine and adnexal pain. [Ingredients] Dang gui (Chinese angelica root), Gui zhi (cinnamon twig), Shao yao (peony root), Mu tong (akebia stem), Da zao (jujube), Xi xin (asarum), Gan cao (licorice).
Contraindications:
Using hanfangchin A for injection should not exceed 300 mg to avoid toxicity.
Guang fang ji is produced in Guangdong. It is also called Guangdong mu fang ji. It belongs to the aristolochiae family and is toxic for the kidneys. 30 g is the toxic dosage.
Guangdong mu fang ji (aristolochiae fangchi) is not the regular mu fang ji which is cocculus trilobus. The whole plant of Guangdong mu fang ji is toxic. Animals or people, eating the flowers or leaves show symptoms of headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, difficulty in breathing, numbness in limbs, etc. See ma dou ling.
Large dosages and/or long term usage of aristolochia fangchi (guang fang ji) is toxic to kidneys.
Research:
Lab animals receiving sinomenin injections showed increase reflex functions, spasms and paralyzed and death.
粉防己鹼是鈣通道阻滯劑, 對鈣激活鉀通道有雙向調節作用, 對心血管系統除具有已熟知的抗高血壓、抗心律失常、擴張冠脈等作用外, 還具有抗心肌缺血-再灌注損傷、抗肺動脈高壓、抗血管平滑肌增殖、抗心肌細胞肥厚和調節心血管活性物質釋放等新型藥理作用 (Fen fang ji alkaloid is a calcium channel blocker, has bidirectional regulatory effect on calcium-activated potassium channels; for the cardiovascular system, in addition to antihypertensive, antiarrhythmic, coronary vasodilation, also has anti-myocardial ischemia-reperfusion injury, anti-pulmonary hypertension, anti-vascular smooth muscle proliferation, anti-myocardial cell hypertrophy, and regulation of release of cardiovascular active substances).
Notes:
Historically those produced in Han Zhong area are called han zhong fang ji and they belonged to the aristolochiae family. Today, when the herb fang ji goes through the area of Han Kou, it is called Han fang ji; so it is not one variety.
Usually in prescriptions, if it is written as "fang ji" it is deemed to be fen fang ji unless it is written as "mu fang ji."
Note: The formula Fu Ke Fen Qing Wan (婦科分清丸) appears on one of the FDA warning sites, but the classical formula does not contain mu tong or fang ji or xi xin, any of which may contain aristolochic acid. It was the formula listed by Zhongguo Yaodi (China Materia Medica) that contains guan mu tong which is Aristolochiae Manshuriensis; or Aristolochia debilis and is toxic to the kidneys.

Mu fang ji: cocculolidine (葉含木防己葉酸 [衡州烏藥裡定鹼])

Moore han fang ji (fen fang ji 粉防己)Aristolochia fangchi, Wu; (guang fang ji 廣防己﹐guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己)Aristolochia westlandi, Hemsl. (guang fang ji 廣防己﹐guangdong mu fang ji 廣東木防己)Cocculus trilobus DC.  (mu fang ji 木防己)Sinomenium acutum var. cinerascens Rhed. et Wils. (mao fang ji 毛防己)Dioloclisia chinensis Merriel (hua fang ji 華防已)Menispermum dauricum De Candolle (bian fu ge 蝙 蝠葛)Aristolochia mouppinensis Franchet (mo ping ma dou ling 穆坪馬兜鈴)Aristolochia kaempferi Willdenow (da ye ma dou ling 大葉馬兜鈴)Pron. in Japanese:日語發音：boiPron. in Korean:韓語發音：bang gi (fang ji 防己);kwang bang gi (guang fang ji 廣防己)Pron. in Cantonese:粤語發音：fong4 gei2Common Name:英文名：stephaniaDistribution:分佈：Han fang ji (fen fang ji) is distributed in Zhejiang, Anhui, Jiangxi, Hubei provinces. Guangdong mu fang ji (guang fang ji) is distributed in Guang Dong and Guang Xi provinces. 漢防己分佈於： 浙江，安徽，江西，湖北等省。廣東木防己分佈 於：廣東和廣西等省。Properties (characteristics):性味：Bitter in taste, acrid and very cold.苦，辛，寒。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經：bladder, spleen and kidney膀胱，脾，腎。Actions & Indications:主治：Usage: Japanese han fang ji is being used pain reliever: inflammation of nerves, stiffness of the shoulders, gouts and back pain. Chinese han fang ji is being used in Bell's palsy, asthma, edema (as an diuretics).Mu fang ji is being used as diuretics for edema and for gonorrhea.日本漢防己用于止痛：神經發炎，肩膀坚硬，痛風，背痛。中國漢防己用于三叉神经痛，哮喘，水腫。木防己作利尿驅水腫與淋病。Medical Function:药理：Lab animals receiving sinomenin injections showed increase reflex functions, spasms and paralyzed and death.Chinese han fang ji showed that it can regulate body temperature. Mu fang ji showed the properties of diuretics and relieve pain of nerve inflammation.粉防己鹼是鈣 通道阻滯劑,對鈣激活鉀通道有雙向調節作用,對心血管系統除具有已熟知的抗高血壓、抗心律失常、擴張冠脈等作用外,還具有抗心肌缺血-再灌注損傷、抗肺動 脈高壓、抗血管平滑肌增殖、抗心肌細胞肥厚和調節心血管活性物質釋放等新型藥理作用Chemical ingredients:化學成份：(1) . Han fang ji: chemicals consist of tetrandin C38H42N2O6 (中 國漢防己鹼)and fangchinoline C37H46N2O6.(防 己諾林鹼)Han fang ji also is produced in Japan. Its chemicals consist of sinomenin C19H22NO4 (鹽酸青藤鹼)(2) Mu fang ji (木 防己) is distributed in Guang Dong and Guang Xi provinces. Its chemicals consist of mufangchinoline C14H21N14O11, thunbergin C20H14O9 (木 防己苷),  trilobine (木 防己鹼 ), isotrilobine (異 木防己鹼), magnoflorine ( 木蘭花鹼 ), trilobamine (木 防已胺 ), normenisarine (去 甲毛木防己鹼  ), menisarine (毛 木防已鹼 ), epistephanine (表 千金藤鹼), coclobine (木 防己賓鹼), cocculolidine (葉 含木防己葉酸 [衡州烏藥裡定鹼 ]).（1）漢防己 （粉防己）含漢防己鹼 C38H42N2O6， 防己諾林鹼C37H46N2O6.. 日本産的漢防己含鹽酸青藤鹼  C19H22NO4（2）木防己含木防己鹼C14H21N14O11， 木防己苷 C20H14O9, 木防己鹼，異 木防己鹼，木 蘭花鹼，木 防已胺，去 甲毛木防己鹼，毛 木防已鹼，表 千金藤鹼，木 防己賓鹼，葉 含木防己葉酸 (衡州烏藥裡定鹼 )。Dosage:用量：5-10 grams boiled with water.Samples of formulae:處方举例： The formulae listed below may contain the toxic type of mu tong or fang ji. Consult your local regulations before using them. Ba Zheng San 八正散 (contains mu tong)Chun Yang Zheng Ji Wan 純 陽正氣丸 (contains qing mu xiang)Da Huang Qing Wei Wan  大黃清胃丸 (contains guan mu tong)Dang gui si ni tang 當歸四逆湯 (contains mu tong and xi xin)Mu Xiang Dao Chi Wan  木香導滯丸 (contains mu xiang and may be confused with qing mu xiang)Die Da Wan 跌打丸 (some Die Da Wan formulae contain mu tong or fang ji)Guan Xin Siu He Ge Wan 冠心秀克閤丸 (contains qing mu xiang)Ji Sheng Ju He Wan 濟生橘核丸 (contains mu tong and hou po)Kat Kit Wan 解結前列丸 (contains mu tong)Quell Fire Shi Xiang Fan Shen Wan 十香翻身(返 神)丸Xin Yi Wan 心怡丸 Cautions:禁忌：using hanfangchin A for injection should not over 300mg to avoid toxicity.Guang fang ji is produced in Guangdong.  It is also called Guangdong mu fang ji. It belongs to the aristolochiae family and is toxic for the kidneys. 30 g is the toxic dosage.Guangdong mu fang ji (aristolochiae fangchi ) is not the regular mu fang ji which is cocculus trilobus. The whole plant of Guangdong mu fang ji is toxic. Animals or people, eating the the flowers or leaves show symptoms of headache, dizziness, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, difficulty in breathing, numbness in limbs, etc.See ma dou ling廣防己全株有毒。人畜誤食新鮮 的莖葉或花，會造成頭痛﹐頭暈﹐噁心﹐嘔吐﹐腹痛﹐呼吸困難﹐四肢麻木等症狀。 Large dosages and/or long term usage of aristolochia fangchi (guang fang ji) is toxic to kidneys. 大劑量或長期服用廣防己對 腎臟有毒。Note:注：Historically those produced in Han Zhong area are called han zhong fang ji and they belonged to the aristolochiae family. Today, when the herb fang ji goes through the area of Han Kou, it is called Han fang ji; so it is not one variety.  歷史上，防己產於漢中的叫做漢中防己。是屬於馬兜鈴科。現在，防己經過漢口的都叫做漢防己。所以不是一種植物。Usually in prescribing if it is written as "fang ji" it is deemed to be fen fang ji unless it is written as "mu fang ji."處方中如不指明�木 防己�而僅寫�防 己�，通常認定為�粉 防己�。Note: The formula,  Fu Ke Fen Qing Wan (婦科分清 丸) shows up on the one of the warning sites of the FDA, but the classical formula does not contain mu tong or fang ji or xi xin, any of which may contain aristolochic acid. It was the formula listed by Zhongguo Yaodi (China Materia Medica) contain guan mu tong which is Aristolochiae Manshuriensis; or Aristolochia debilis and is toxic to the kidneys.當歸四逆湯[主治效能] 治貧血、腰痛、拘攣、四肢痠痛、厥冷等症。應用於凍瘡、腸疝痛、腰痛、腳氣、子宮及其附屬器所引起之腹痛。[組成藥物]當歸、桂枝、芍藥、木通、大棗、細辛、甘草。 Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告    A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading  in progress  Click here for comment.. a.m. LA

Geography: Sulfatedfucan is extracted from a sea weed, Laminaria japonica.
Medical Function: anti-tumor: fucoidans inhibit the heparinase of cancer cells and inhibit secretion of growth factors of cancer cells. These growth factors are attached to the sulfated heparin. Fucoidans also have strong attraction to some of those growth factors and prevent them from returning to combine with the cancer cells. The cancer cells that have combined with fucoidans become malnourished and the reproduction function of the cancer cells will become weakened and exhausted. Its result is to inhibit infiltration of cancer cells into surrounding tissue, thus anti-tumor.
anti-virus
antibiotic
anti platelet coagulation: anti blood clot
lower blood lipids
suppresses overly active auto immune system
促進腎臟損傷的修復作用 (promotes repair of kidney injury)
anti-oxidant
Contraindications: It should not contain excessive amount of arsenic, cadmium and mercury.

They are widely dispersed in the cell walls of kelp.Pharmaceutical name:fucoidanChemical name:Sulfated fucanDistribution:Sulfatedfucan is extracted from a sea weed, Laminaria japonica.The main production areas are China and Japan.岩藻聚糖硫酸酯 提取于海帶科植物海帶（Laminaria japonica ）Properties(characteristics):性狀﹕light yellow powder; can be dissolved in water.微黄色粉末，能溶于水Channels (meridians) entered: Medical Functions:     藥理﹕Medical Functions:anti-tumor: fucoidans inhibit the heparinase of cancer cells and  inhibits secretion of growth factors of cancer cells. These growth factors are attached to the sulfated heparin. Fucoidans also have strong attraction to some of those growth factors and prevent them to return to the combining to the cancer cells. The cancer cells that have combined with fucoidans become mal-nourished and  the reproduction function of the cancer cells will become weakened and exhausted.anti-virus.antibioticanti platelet coagulation: anti blood clotlower blood lipidssuppresses overly active auto immune system [1]藥理﹕抗凝作用，促進腎臟損傷的修復作用，抗氧化、抗血脂、抗凝血、岩藻聚糖硫酸酯 的抗癌作用：  抑制癌细胞所分泌的肝素酶，使得附着硫酸類肝素的癌细胞增殖因子难以游离出来；另外，岩藻聚糖硫酸酯 對一部分的增殖因子有很强的吸附作用，所以可將從硫酸類肝素上游離出 來的增殖因子吸附，避免其回復結合到癌细胞。和岩藻聚糖硫酸酯 結合後的癌细胞由於無法獲取增殖因子，漸漸發生 營養不足、增殖能力减弱、逐漸趋向衰竭，其結果使得癌细胞向周围組織的浸潤受到抑制而 抗 腫瘤、抑制免疫作用Actions & Indications:Supplement to cancer therapyChemical ingredients:Sulfated fucan岩藻多糖硫酸酯Dosage: Cautions and toxicity:It should not contain excessive amount of arsenic, cadmium and mercury.  Search this site       Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告  A manuscript... writing, translating and proofreading                          in progressClick here for comment.
